This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2: Increased and equitable access to quality education for the most marginalised children aged 3-18 years.

title.narrative: Output 2.4: Strengthened capacity to implement the Safe School initiative.

description.narrative: UNICEF intensively supports the Ministry of Education and Culture (MoEC) in responding to the COVID-19 pandemic focusing on regulation development, cluster coordination through the National Safe School Secretariat, risks communication and capacity building. This to ensure safety and education continuity of some 60 million students during the pandemic situation. UNICEF is also working closely with local partner in Central Sulawesi and with the Ministry of Village in Nusa Tenggara Barat (NTB) to support comprehensive School Safety and comprehensive adolescent resilience building programme in disaster affected communities with 22,424 children (11,168 girls; 11,256 boys) have been reached in these locations. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/07/2020
